main.name: Eric Leong
main.bio: Hello~ I'm Eric. I'm currently a Sophomore at UC Berkeley. I came into Berkeley intending to study Biology and pursue the pre-med route for medical school. However, out of interest, I decided to take a Computer Science class and I enjoyed the class so much that decided to study Computer Science instead. Despite aiming to work in the industry as a Software Engineer, I still partake in research in areas related to Biology though I contribute to projects primarily through developing computational applications.
main.life: Besides my interest in the intersection between Biology and Computer Science, I am fond of Full Stack Development as a result of prior classes and projects in Web Development. Currently, I'm trying to develop my skills in Full Stack by acting as a Web Committee Director of Berkeley's local IEEE chapter. I've also started working as a Full Stack Engineering Intern at a Berkeley startup, CatalistX.

education.description: Computer Programs • Data Structures • Artificial Intelligence • Algorithms • Computer-Architecture • Discrete Math • Probability

work.title: Full Stack Engineering Intern
work.description: I work with the lead developer on creating features on our product, a website that establishes a connection between growing start ups and college students interested in working at start ups.

work.title: Web Committee Director
work.description: I lead the website committee of the Berkeley branch of IEEE. As a committee, we update and develop features for our organization's website.

work.title: Undergraduate Research
work.description: I am a research assistant for Professor Williams and Professor Sudmant, assisting them in their joint research project to find a molecular basis for convergence of dormancy. In other words, we are trying to show that all the different forms of hibernations, in both mammals and insects, have a genetic basic. So far, my partner and I have developed an algorithm that efficiently finds gene mapping, given a set of species and genes. Furthermore, we've developed a formatter that converts the output, into a structure that is readily used by many genetic analysis programs, including PAML.

projects.title: Vampires Textgame
projects.category: Java textgame that I created out of boredom.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
